title: The Friendly Robot
lyrics:
I have a robot, big and grand,
The best robot in the land.
He helps me clean my room each day,
Then we both go out to play.
funFact: The word 'robot' comes from the Czech word 'robota', which means 'forced labor' or 'work'.

title: The Sleepy Bear
lyrics:
The sleepy bear goes to his bed,
Lays down his big and fuzzy head.
He dreams of honey, sweet and deep,
While all the little bunnies sleep.
funFact: Bears can sleep for several months during the winter in a process called hibernation.

title: My Rocket Ship Adventure
lyrics:
Five, four, three, two, one we go,
My rocket ship is putting on a show!
Past the clouds and up so high,
We'll draw a circle in the sky.

We zoom around the yellow moon,
And dance among the stars in tune.
Then we come back home to bed,
With sleepy thoughts inside my head.
funFact: It takes about three days for a rocket to travel from the Earth to the Moon.

title: The Wiggle Worm
lyrics:
I'm a little wiggle worm,
Watch me squirm and squirm.
I wiggle in the dirt all day,
Then I wiggle, far away!
funFact: Earthworms are very helpful because they create tunnels in the soil, which helps air and water reach the roots of plants.

title: The Popcorn Song
lyrics:
Pop, pop, popcorn,
Popping in the pot.
Pop, pop, popcorn,
Eat it while it's hot!

Pop, pop, popcorn,
White and fluffy, too.
Pop, pop, popcorn,
I'll share a piece with you!
funFact: A single kernel of popcorn can pop up to 3 feet in the air!

title: My Happy Kite
lyrics:
My kite, my kite, flies in the sky,
Soaring, soaring, way up high.
Dancing with the wind so free,
Look, my kite is waving at me!
funFact: Kites were invented in China over 2,000 years ago.

title: The Little Owl
lyrics:
The sun is gone, the moon is bright,
A little owl says 'Hoo!' at night.
He spreads his wings and starts to fly,
Beneath the starry, sleepy sky.
funFact: Owls can turn their heads almost all the way around, but they can't move their eyes.

title: Silly Starfish
lyrics:
Silly little starfish,
Spinning in the blue,
Doing cartwheels in the sea,
Just for me and you.
funFact: Starfish can regrow their arms if they lose one!

title: The Mighty Rex
lyrics:
The mighty Rex with a toothy grin,
Makes the whole jungle shake and spin.
He gives a roar, a mighty sound,
Then takes a nap upon the ground.
funFact: Despite its ferocious reputation, some scientists think the T-Rex might have had feathers!

title: Mr. Snail
lyrics:
Slowly, slowly, Mr. Snail,
Crawling down the garden trail.
He carries his house upon his back,
Then hides inside, it's black, black, black.

But when the sun begins to peek,
He slowly lifts his head to speak.
He says, "Hello, my friend, so grand!"
And crawls out on his house-in-hand.
funFact: Some snails can sleep for up to three years!

title: Penguin Parade
lyrics:
Down the snowy hill they slide,
What a fun and slippery ride!
Then they waddle, side-by-side,
It's the penguin parade!
funFact: The way penguins waddle actually helps them save energy as they walk.

title: The Baking Song
lyrics:
Mix the flour, crack the egg,
Stir the batter with your leg!
Just kidding, use a spoon instead,
Time to make some gingerbread!
funFact: The tradition of making decorated gingerbread houses started in Germany in the 1800s.

title: The Bouncing Ball
lyrics:
A bouncing ball, a bouncing ball,
Bouncing up against the wall.
It bounces high, it bounces low,
Where will the bouncing ball go?
funFact: The first basketballs were not bouncy at all! They were made of leather panels stitched together with a rubber bladder inside, much like a soccer ball.

title: The Little Frog
lyrics:
A little frog on a lily pad,
Was feeling just a little sad.
Then he jumped up with a CROAK!
And that was the best froggy joke.
funFact: Frogs don't need to drink water; they absorb it through their skin.

title: The Squirrel's Nut
lyrics:
A little squirrel with a tail so grand,
Found the biggest nut in all the land.
He buried it deep beside a tree,
To eat in winter, just for he.
funFact: Squirrels pretend to bury nuts to fool other animals who might be watching them, then they hide the real nut somewhere else!

title: The Friendly Ghost
lyrics:
There's a friendly ghost who floats and flies,
He has two big and happy eyes.
He doesn't want to make you scared,
He just wants his teddy bear.

He finds his bear right on the floor,
And hugs it tight and starts to snore.
He's happy now, his day is blessed,
The friendly ghost can go to rest.
funFact: The idea of ghosts being white and floaty comes from old traditions where burial cloths, called shrouds, were usually white.

title: The Happy Dolphin
lyrics:
Splash and flip, so fast and free,
A happy dolphin in the sea.
He jumps and clicks and says hello,
To all the little fish below.
funFact: Dolphins sleep with only half of their brain at a time, and they keep one eye open to watch for predators.

title: The Moon's Goodnight
lyrics:
The moon peeks out from cloudy skies,
And winks its sleepy, silver eyes.
It's time for bed, you sleepy head,
Goodnight, goodnight, the moonlight said.
funFact: The moon doesn't make its own light! It reflects the light from the sun, just like a giant mirror in the sky.

title: The Little Boat
lyrics:
My little boat upon the sea,
Sails along so happily.
The wind it pushes, soft and low,
This way and that way we will go.
funFact: Sailboats don't have engines; they use the power of the wind in their sails to move across the water.

title: The Sleepy Volcano
lyrics:
There's a sleepy volcano, taking a nap,
With a fluffy white cloud for a thinking cap.
He rumbles and grumbles, a sleepy sound,
Shaking the flowers all over the ground.
funFact: When a volcano erupts, the hot liquid rock that comes out is called lava.

title: The Butterfly
lyrics:
A little caterpillar, slow and green,
Became the prettiest bug you've seen.
She grew some wings and fluttered high,
A lovely, painted butterfly.
funFact: Butterflies taste with their feet! It helps them find the right leaf to lay their eggs on.

title: My Little Wooden Horse
lyrics:
Saddle up my horse of wood,
On his back, I've always stood.
With a tail of rope and a happy sound,
We gallop all over the town!
funFact: Wooden pull-toys have been a childhood classic for hundreds of years, encouraging imagination and play.

title: The City Bus
lyrics:
The big red bus goes beep, beep, beep,
While all the people are asleep.
The doors swing open, wide and grand,
To take us all across the land.
funFact: The first city buses were pulled by horses!

title: My Little Teacup
lyrics:
I have a little teacup,
It's shiny, small, and round.
When I pour the tea in,
It makes a happy sound.
funFact: Having a tea party with toys and friends is a fun way to practice being a good host.

title: The Happy Peacock
lyrics:
Grandma saw a peacock bright,
With feathers of blue and green.
He danced around in the morning light,
The prettiest bird she's seen.
funFact: A peacock's long, beautiful feathers are called a 'train'.

title: When I'm Feeling Glad
lyrics:
When I'm feeling glad, a happy song I hum,
I tap my feet just like a little drum.
I give a wiggle, then a little leap,
While all the grumpy feelings fall asleep.
funFact: Doing something active, like dancing or jumping, can make you feel even happier!

title: Panda's Peaceful Snack
lyrics:
A happy panda, soft and grand,
Chews on bamboo in his land.
Munch, munch, munch, the whole day long,
Humming a quiet, happy song.
funFact: Pandas have a special bone in their wrist that acts like a thumb to help them grip bamboo stalks.

title: Clever Monkey
lyrics:
Monkey wears a silly hat,
And has a friendly chatter-chat.
He swings from branches in the sun,
And has a lot of monkey fun.

He climbs the trees up to the top,
And gives a little playful hop.
He pulls a funny face for you,
And waves his tail and says "Achoo!"
funFact: Monkeys use their long tails to help them balance as they swing through the trees.

title: The Mighty Elephant
lyrics:
Elephant king, so big and gray,
Swings his trunk along the way.
He says hello with a happy toot,
And stomps his great big elephant foot.
funFact: An elephant's trunk is so strong and skillful it can pick up something as heavy as a log or as small as a single grain of rice.

title: Timothy's Tuba
lyrics:
Timothy found a tuba bright,
He puffed his cheeks with all his might.
Instead of music, out came a pop,
And a shower of lemon drops!
funFact: Tubas are the largest brass instruments in an orchestra and make the lowest sounds.

title: Silly Billy Goat
lyrics:
Silly Billy Goat went to the fair,
With a bright blue ribbon in his hair.
He tipped his hat and tapped his toe,
And put on a funny show.

He balanced books upon his nose,
And jumped and twirled upon his toes.
He sang a song and took a bow,
He's the silliest goat, you'll agree right now!

title: My Counting Game
lyrics:
Let's play a game and count to one,
Tap your head, the game's begun.
Let's play a game and count to two,
Touch your nose and then your shoe.

Let's play a game and count to three,
Touch your tummy, one, two, three.
Let's play a game and count to four,
Clap your hands and ask for more!

title: Down by the Gate
lyrics:
Down by the gate, gate, gate,
Stood a little cat, cat, cat,
With a fuzzy hat, hat, hat,
Imagine that, that, that!

title: The Alphabet's Echo
lyrics:
A is for Achoo! when you sneeze,
B is for Buzzing like the bees.
C is for Clapping, one, two, three,
D is for Dancing, wild and free!
funFact: The English alphabet has 26 letters, but some languages have many more or many fewer!

title: Time for a Snack
lyrics:
The clock strikes four, it's time to eat,
Time to eat, time to eat.
The clock strikes four, it's time to eat,
Let's have a tasty treat.

title: A Fuzzy Caterpillar
lyrics:
I found a fuzzy caterpillar,
Won't my mommy be so thrilled with her?
I found a fuzzy caterpillar,
Whoops! She's tickling my chin!

title: The Magical Garden
lyrics:
In a magical garden, the flowers can sing,
And butterflies whisper on shimmering wing.
The clouds are all fluffy like cotton candy sweet,
A wonderful place for my two little feet.
